medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric pain, nausea, and non-bloody non-bilious emesis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient had acute onset of pain shortly after lunch at noon. He vomited multiple times following this. He has experienced more mild bouts of epigastric pain 1-2 times a month over the past few months, mainly occurring at night after fatty dinners. The first daytime episode occurred one week ago, was severe, and accompanied by nausea, without emesis, and one white stool. Jaundice was noted three days ago, along with fatty, yellow, foul-smelling stools.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Significant weight loss of 160 lbs over past 16 months (intentional). No other past medical history noted. Past surgical history includes tonsillectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Mother and sister have undergone cholecystectomy (CCY); two paternal aunts have undergone CCY; maternal grandmother has kidney cancer; no history of colon or biliary cancers.
